ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS : 1819 : 1819

BLOCK NO. 1819 OF RADDOLUGAMA HOUSING SCHEME 0859/067 04.

( ) (The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) - (1) : () (i) 1819, 23 , 2006.02.28 /2/4/2/1 ; (ii) 73 ; (iii) . 2006.04.28, 2006.10.03 2006.05.17 , ? () ? () 3//1- , ? () 23(2 ? () , ?

, : () (i) . 1819 23 2006.02.28 /2/4/2/1 , (ii) 73 , (iii) . . 2006.04.28, 2006.05.17 2006.10.03 ? () ? () 3//1 - , () 23(2) ? () , ?

asked the Minister of Housing and Public Amenities : (a) Is she aware that, (i) the Secretary to the President. Mr. Lalith Weeratunga has informed the National Housing Development Authority by letter dated 28.02.2006 and Reference No. SP/24/2/1, that it is suitable to sell and transfer block No.1819 of the Raddolugama Housing Scheme to the recipients of houses who have enjoyed ownership of them for 23years; (ii) the relevant General Manager has rejected it giving a wrong interpretation to Section 73 of the Housing Authority Act; (iii) he has refused to answer letters sent by the Assistant Secretary of the President, Mr. Saman D. Waduge and the Director of the Ministery of Housing, Mr. Sunil Kannangara on 28.04.2006 03.10.2006 and 17.05.2006 respectively?

2007 10 3329 3330

(b) Will she admit that the above General Manager has no legal powers to act in violation of the orders of His Excelency the President? (c) Will she take steps to grant this block of land to the above recipients of houses in accordance with the said letter of the Secretary to the President as this block of land adjoining the house 3/B/1-L of Raddolugama has been sold and transferred to one Mr. Anton De Alwis by the General Manager? (d) Will she take action to implement formally, Section 23(2) of the Housing Authority Act which has been violated? (e) If not, why?

( ) ( () - , ) (The Hon. (Mrs.) Ferial Ismail Ashraff Minister of Housing and Common Amenities) () (i) , (ii) 1819 . 1999.07.11 . 1819 . 8/1/2/250 2007.05.04 . (iii) . . 8/1/2/250 2006.10.25 . () . () 3/B/1-L . () II .

LICENCES ISSUED BY NATIONAL TRANSPORT COMMISSION FOR PASSENGER TRANSPORT SERVICES 0791/06 7.

( ) (The Hon. Vijitha Herath) (2): () ? () 2000 , , , , , ?

() (i) , , , (ii) , (iii) , ? () (i) , (ii) , , (iii) , (iv) , (v) , ? () , ?

: () ? () 2000 , , , , , , ? () (i) , , , , (ii) , (iii) ? () (i) , (ii) , , (iii) , (iv) , (v) ? () , ?

2007 10 3333 3334

asked the Minister of Transport (2), : (a) Will he inform this House in detail, the procedure followed by the National Transport Commission in issuing licences for buses for passenger transport services ? (b) Will he submit to this House separately, the number of passenger transport service licences issued by the said Commission since the year 2000 up to now along with the names of the licensees, their addresses, the registered numbers of those buses, the relevant routes, the dates of application for licence and the dates on which licences were issued ? (c) Will he state separately, - (i) if routes have been revised out of those the names of the licensees concerned, their addresses and the registered numbers of the buses, (ii) the former routes and the revised routes; and (iii) the dates of application for revision and the dates revisions were issued ? (d) Will he inform this House, - (i) the number of those who have applied for route revisions but not granted so far; (ii) their names, addresses and the dates of application for licences ; (iii) the reasons for not granting the said revisions; (iv) whether approval will be granted for those in future; and, (v) for which licences ? (e) If not, why ?

( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Dullas Alahapperuma - Minister of Transport) () , . , . . 2001 2004 . () . 2000 01 . . * . () 02 *. () . . . () .

asked the Minster of Enterprise Development and Investment Promotion : (a) Will he inform this House, the responsibilities of the Minister of Enterprise Development and Investment Promotion and the non-Cabinet Minister of Enterprise Development? (b) Will he state in this House separately, the institutions that come under the purview of the said Ministers? (c) Will he state as to how the responsibilities of the above Cabinet Minister and the non-Cabinet Minister differ from each other? and,

) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem - Minister of Posts and Telecommunication) Mr. Speaker, may I be heard?

3479 3480

2007 10

( ) (Mr. Speaker) . [ ] ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) Mr. Speaker, we have to be mindful of the issues here. In fact you summoned a meeting of the Party Leaders. You suspended Sittings in order to meet and discuss the issues that have been raised. And then in deference to your request the senior leaders of the TNA came; they went back and persuaded the Member to come with an apology. There were certain party leaders who were not present at the meeting or they boycotted the meeting. Thereafter, the Member concerned came here and made a Statement. The Statement has its own implications may be outside this House and in the House as well. But then you are the custodian of the rights of all the Members of this House, not only the Members belonging to one party; even an individual Member and his rights. Now there is intense pressure being brought on you to name a Member. To name a Member there must be unruly conduct by the Member. As it is, that Member is not creating any rumpus here. He, in deference to your request, came here and made a statement which he believed is a sufficient apology. So, if you think that it is sufficient, be brave enough to say so. And, then we will accept it. That is what I feel. If the others are not prepared to accept it we cannot run this House. [Interruption.] ( ) (The Hon. Wimal Weerawansa) . , ? . , , . . . , ? [ ] ? [ ] ? [ ] ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , I must state that I differ with the view expressed by the Hon. Rauff Hakeem. Unruly behaviour is not the issue that was raised. It was on a Constitutional matter on terrorism. It is much more grave, which covers unruly behaviour if the Member does not abide by the decision of the Speaker. The Speaker very clearly interpreted the relevant Articles of the Constitution before the House was suspended. Hon. Speaker, you accepted the position raised by the Hon. Wimal Weerawansa in relation to the Sixth Amendment to the Constitution and that the relevant Articles in the Constitution are above Sections of any other Act that would interpret this as only unruly behaviour. How does

a Member become unruly? Is it only physically? No. If a Member is unruly to the Chair, if the Chair appeals to a Member to follow a certain procedure or make an apology or an explanation and if it is not adhered to, then it amounts to unruly behaviour. The Member has very clearly stated that he has not hurt the feelings of the other Members or the Sinhalese. That is all. That is not an apology. Does that clear himself of the utterance he made yesterday? It is a very sad situation where we feel the TNA leaders are unable to convince their own Member to make this apology. But if an apology is not made or if this statement is not withdrawn, how is the Chair going to accept this? It can be repeated over and over by the Members. I am sorry that the Hon. Hakeem is trying to interpret it in a way that you should accept what he has said. ( ) (The Hon. Wimal Weerawansa) , , . . . ( ) (An hon. Member) .

( ) (The Hon. Wimal Weerawansa) . . . - [ ] . "" . . , . . ; . , , . . . . , . , " ; " . . . . ; .
